properties.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 10 at 11:53AM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Upgraded to Wind Advisory for entire Tahoe basin due
to stronger winds in recent simulations.

* WHAT...South to southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 45 to
60 mph expected around the Lake Tahoe basin. Sierra ridges
gusting over 100 mph. Large waves of 4-6 feet on Lake Tahoe,
especially on the east and northeast sides.

* WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area and around Truckee.

* WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Saturday. Peak winds
between Midnight and 8 AM Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
Extremely rough water can be expected on Lake Tahoe Friday night
and nearly all of Saturday. Minor beach erosion is possible
along east and northeast shores of Lake Tahoe.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations (if you really still have those up),
and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items
away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making
sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare
batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY
